instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPRTC_G3H: What is PPRTC_G3H? This is a typo of PPVRTC_G3H When you see PPRTC_G3H, assume they meant to type PPVRTC_G3H.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message:
Hi Group,

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> -B logic board where when I plug in the charger I get the green light but the fan does not spin. I tried measuring all the components with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, and everywhere I get is 12.56 volts. Also on further measuring the power rails I found the following that <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> every component instead of showing 5V is showing Zero (0) volts. I presume that the problem is in the S3 power rails. On further troubleshooting I figured out that <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> chip the voltage on Pin 12 which is a S5 rail it should measure 3.3V but it only measures 1.295V. I presume that the <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> chip is bad. Again on further troubleshooting I found out that the <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> should have 5 volts but does not 5V. Am I correct in my troubleshooting steps. Correct me if I am wrong. Can anyone please advice what further steps is to be taken in order for me to make this board working. Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message:
Check if <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> on L7260 pulses when you connect the charger, best seen on a scope, multimeter is too slow. Make sure you use a REAL 60W charger.
Check all coils for shorts to GND.
This usually does not "just" happen, inspect for liquid and ask customer what happened.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: Hi Duke, Apparently I don't have a scope.  I tried checking it with a Multimeter on VDC and there is a couple of changing figures, which finally settles down to 0.0000v.  I am using a 85W ORIGINAL Power adapter would that make a difference.  I would need more help with your statement "Check all coils for shorts to GND.  I asked the customer and there is no liquid damage, neither I see any liquid damage to the board.  The customer mentioned that it was working one night and the next day morning it did not want to come on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message:
Hi Duke,

I was trying to measure voltage on every PIN on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> chip and while measuring from Pin 1 and progressing forward, I observed that when I measure Pin 5 by keeping the Black probe to ground and Red probe to Pin 5 the FAN STARTS TO SPIN. If i remove the probe the Fan stops. What does that indicate ? The Pin 5 is <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_VFB</SIGNAL>. It sometimes happens on Pin 6 as well.Please advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: Hi Duke,  As i mentioned in my chat an 1 hour ago, that when i touch the red probe to one of the pins either 5 or 6 ( not sure ) the fan spins.  This is what i did - I connected the logic board back into the computer connected all the cables including the LCD connector.  and then went ahead and touched the red probe to one of the pins 5 or 6 ( not sure ) and black probe to the ground.  The computer came one with a Chime.  So does this indicate that the <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> is bad or is there something that i need to check.  Please advice as what should I do further.  Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: Hi Duke,  I don't know if what I did was correct.  I put some flux on the <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> and heat the chip in little bit.  After that now the green light on the charger does not want to come on.  Please advice what is wrong that I am doing so that I can fix it and make this board working.  Louis, please advice if you feel I am doing something wrong.  Regards,

threads.message: <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> cannot affect the green light. What is PPBUS? Magsafe board killed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: Check voltages on both sides of <RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR>/1/2/3

threads.message: Hi Duke, I checked the voltages and all <RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR>/1/2/3 and they measure 0.42 V except <RESISTOR>R1801</RESISTOR> which measures 0.38 on Pin 2 .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message:
check voltage on both side and report them. ADD Ohms for each

simple
<RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR> pin 1 3,0 volt pin 2 0,8volt.

etc

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR>  Pin 1 and Pin 2 - 0.42
<RESISTOR>R1801</RESISTOR>  Pin 1    -  0.42V
             Pin 2    -  0.38V
<RESISTOR>R1802</RESISTOR>  Pin 1 and Pin 2 - 0.42V
<RESISTOR>R1803</RESISTOR> Pin 1 and Pin 2  - 0.42V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: There should be 3V there. Check voltages on <CAPACITOR>C2231</CAPACITOR>/32/33

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: Hi Duke, I am getting 0.42V at all the 3 caps - <CAPACITOR>C2231</CAPACITOR>/32/33.  Also i went ahead and checked the <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> where the Pin 1 which is <SIGNAL>VDD_RTC_OUT</SIGNAL> is showing me 0.42V.  Is this correct.  Please advice further.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: Voltage on pin 13 from <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>?? Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: Answer aprendiz' question. Also tell me if you have reached any conclusions about what you think is wrong here. stare long and hard at <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> on the power rails page.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: Hi Louis / aprendiz,  I check the voltage on Pin 13 and I get 3.44 V.  And honestly I did not understand the 2nd question of aprendiz about Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>.  Louis I looked at the <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> and the <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> rails and I am unable to come at a conclusion yet as to what could be wrong.  I see a little corrosion by <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> and Y2805 is a little rusted.  Please help.

threads.message: Duke, can you please help. Regards,  Raj.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: First get green light back. 3v42 present? Magsafe/adapter ok? PPBUS voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message:
Raj:

I mean this in the nicest way possible, but this requires effort on both sides. I need for you to think. You have to work with us here or this is impossible, and right now you are not thinking at all.

You said <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is corroded. You can see on the schematic that <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> comes from <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>. You can also see on the schematic that <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> on page 7/8 is 3.3v. You get 0.4v on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>.

So

1) <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> is supposed to be 3.3v.
2) <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0.4v
3) <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> creates <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>.
4) <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is corroded & rusted looking.

I need for you to be able to take this information that we have brought to light and come to a conclusion. Even if it is wrong, some conclusion. If you can't do this, then stop until you can.

Also answer duke's question on whether <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is present, and what <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage is.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Green light on, Fan does not spin
threads.message: Louis, thanks for your feedback.  Tomorrow I shall positively go through even step provided and get you the conclusion of what I think.  Even if I am wrong I will comment because I know I have the masters to correct me if I am wrong.  Thanks a million once again Louis, Duke and the whole rossmann group team.  Regards and Bye for now.
